message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV, cs.CL. 

The paper presents a theoretical result that generalises the Discriminative Restricted Boltzmann Machine (DRBM), which is a popular machine learning model used in various applications such as image classification, natural language processing, and speech recognition. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), which covers topics related to the development and analysis of machine learning algorithms. 

The paper also discusses the performance of the proposed DRBM variants on benchmark datasets such as MNIST and 20 Newsgroups, which suggests that the paper may also belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-categories. 

Furthermore, since the DRBM is often used in computer vision and natural language processing tasks, the paper may also belong to cs.CV (Computer Vision) and cs.CL (Computation and Language) sub-categories.
